introduction: The Investigation Task Force (ITF) has been investigating an allegation regarding administrative irregularities regarding the insurance coverage for Pristina Airport by a London-based Company.
applicable_laws_and_procedural_rules: UNMIK regulations 1999/2 – Finance Administration Instruction on Public Procurement using Kosovo Consolidated Funds.
methodology: The ITF determined that the responsible Manager did not undertake efforts in 2002 or 2003 to invite international tenders for the Airport’s insurance coverage.
background_information: The Manager did not prepare an international tender for at least the period 2 October 2003 to 1 October 2004.
The ITF investigation also adduced evidence of double insurance coverage at Pristina International Airport.
investigation_details: The Manager had direct contact with Insurance Company 2 for the preparation of the new coverage.
The contract with Insurance Company 1 covered the period 2 October 2003 to 1 October 2004.
ITF investigators have conducted three administrative interviews, including of the suspect.
conclusions: The ITF believes there is a prima facie case against the Manager for offence(s) against the Provisional Criminal Procedure Code of Kosovo.
recommendations: The ITF advises that the matter be forwarded to the Department of Justice for appropriate judicial review.
others: Any questions or comments on the above information should be addressed to Mr Wolfgang Nikolaus, Head, ITF.
